Business_Process_Parameters.description: When set to "true" or "1", the business process is automatically processed. This means that all approvals will be automatically approved in the system, all reviews and to-do's will be automatically by-passed, and all notifications will be automatically suppressed.

Indicates the transaction should process to completion before the response is generated.  Note: All < v12 operations will process with Run_Now = True for backwards compatibility but please review this setting in your environment for performance conditions.

Enforces all validation conditions defined on the initiation step.  If any condition is true, the validation error blocks the step from exiting and a business process event isn't created. The attribute is currently not available for use. It will be generally available for all web services in a future release.

Business_Process_Comment_Data.description: Free form comment regarding the business process.

validation.validation: This Business Process has been configured to disable comment. Please remove the comment or change the setting in the Business Process Policy or tenant setup.

WorkerObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

WorkerObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

WorkerObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Business_Process_Comment_Data.description: Default the Person making the comment to the processing person if not submitted via the web service.

Business_Process_Parameters.description: Captures a comment for the Business Process.

Business_Process_Attachment_Data.description: Free form text comment about the attachment.

Event_Attachment_CategoryObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Event_Attachment_CategoryObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Event_Attachment_CategoryObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

validation.validation: This Business Process Type has been configured to not accept Attachment Categories.

Business_Process_Attachment_Data.description: Text attribute identifying Content Type of the Attachment.

Business_Process_Parameters.description: Element for the attachments pertaining to a Event entered through a web service.

validation.validation: This Business Process Type has been configured to not accept Event Attachments.

description: Container for the processing options for a business process. If no options are submitted (or the options are submitted as 'false') then the business process is simply initiated as if it where submitted on-line with approvals, reviews, notifications and to-do's in place. If the Initiator is an Integration System User, any validations you configured on the Initiation step are ignored.

Course_SectionObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Course_SectionObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Course_SectionObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Submit_Grades_for_Registrations_Data.description: Reference to an existing Section Listing that Students have registered in.

StudentObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

StudentObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

StudentObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Student_Grades_Data.description: Reference to an existing Student who is registered in the Section Listing.

validation.validation: The Student must have an active registration in the Section Listing and cannot have an existing Student Grade.
There is an in progress Grading Event for the Student and Section Listing.

Student_GradeObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Student_GradeObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Student_GradeObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Student_Grades_Data.description: Reference to an existing Student Grade to assign for the Student.

validation.validation: The Student Grade must be of the set of Student Grades in the Grading Scheme defined on the Enrollment Access Rule Set for the Student Course of the Section Listing and match the Grading Basis of the registration or in the overridden Grading Scheme.
You cannot specify a withdrawal grade for any registration.

Student_Grades_Data.description: Element Container for Student Grade Due Date

validation.validation: The Student Grade Due Date is required when the Student Grade is of type Incomplete and is not allowed for other types.

Student_Grades_Data.description: Grade Note for the Student Grade
Student Registration Record Last Date of Attendance

validation.validation: Enter a Last Date Of Attendance that is on or between the course section start and end dates: [Start Date] and [End Date].

Submit_Grades_for_Registrations_Data.description: Element containing the Student Grades Data (Student Reference and Student Grade Reference)

validation.validation: Grade Notes are not allowed for the selected Grade.
A Grade Note is required for the selected Grade.
Last Date of Attendance is not allowed for the selected Grade.
Last Date of Attendance is required for the selected Grade.

description: Submit Grades for Registrations Data contains the data needed to add a Student Grade to a Student Course Registration

validation.validation: The Student Course Section for the Section Listing must have already started to be valid for grading.
The Student Course Section for the Section Listing must be of the Instructional Format that controls grading.
The Student Course Section for the Section Listing must have Registered Student Course Registrations for grading.
